overview: Featuring 45 Hanna-Barbera cartoon characters (classic and otherwise) competing for gold medals in wacky events. The contests are between: "Yogi Yahooeys," "The Scooby Doobys" and "The Really Rottens". Events include racing on ostriches, camels, kangaroos, rickshaws and unicycles, as well as scavenging for creatures like the Abominable Snowman, vampires, and the Loch Ness Monster.

episodes.title: Scooby-Doo! Spooky Games
episodes.description: As Shaggy and Scooby are running away from a monster, Olympic Games organizer Diane watches Shaggy and Scooby's amazing running ability and asks them to join the 2012 World Invitational games (a parody of the 2012 Summer Olympics) in London. Shaggy accepts the offer, while Scooby is unable to join (because he is not human). Instead, Scooby-Doo becomes Shaggy's coach. The gang is flown on an all-expenses-paid trip to London so Shaggy can participate in the games. When they arrive, Daphne and Velma become interested in Steve Looker, an Olympic pole vaulter, causing Fred to want to become a pole vaulter in the games. The gang then goes to their hotel room, and Scooby hears a loud stomping noise outside while he is watching a Gladiatorsaurus marathon on TV. Shaggy and Scooby take a peek at what is going on, and find that a 2000-year-old Olympic statue has come to life and is terrorizing the city.

episodes.title: The Swiss Alps and Tokyo, Japan
episodes.description: Three teams of athletes compete in sports events around the world. In this case they ski, skate, and ride toboggans in Switzerland; and sumo wrestle, play tennis, and play baseball in Tokyo, Japan.

episodes.title: Acapulco and England
episodes.description: The contestants do cliff diving, an underwater relay race, and a speedboat race in Acapulco, Mexico; and climb the side of Big Ben, hunt a fox, and play polo in England.

episodes.title: Florida and China
episodes.description: The contestants do swamp boat racing, water-skiing, and car racing in the Everglades, Florida; rickshaw racing, ping-pong playing, and gymnastics in Hong Kong, China.

episodes.title: The Sahara Desert and Scotland
episodes.description: The contestants do a dune buggy race and a "fill up the oasis well" contest in the Sahara; and a Loch Ness monster photograph race and a three-legged kilt race in Scotland.

episodes.title: France and Australia
episodes.description: The contestants do a "Tour de France" bicycle race and a "capture the flag at the top of the Eiffel Tower" contest; and a boomerang throw and a kangaroo race in Australia.

episodes.title: Athens, Greece and the Ozarks
episodes.description: The contestants do pole vaulting and discus throwing in Athens; and a rail cart race and a keel-boat race in the Ozarks.

episodes.title: Italy and Kitty Hawk, North Carolina
episodes.description: The contestants do a motor scooter race and a canal boat race in Italy; and hang gliding, skydiving, and a hot air balloon race at Kitty Hawk.

episodes.title: Egypt and Sherwood Forest
episodes.description: The contestants do a "touch the tip of the pyramid" race and a camel race in Egypt; and an armored foot race and a "princess rescue contest" in Sherwood Forest.

episodes.title: Spain and the Himalayas
episodes.description: The contestants do a bullfight and a Gypsy wagon race in Spain; and a "hang the bell on the Abominable Snowman" contest and a climbing Mount Neverest relay race in the Himalayas.

episodes.title: India and Israel
episodes.description: The contestants do a tiger hunt and an elephant-back race in India; and wind-sail sand-sledding contest and a reed boat race in Israel.

episodes.title: The Grand Canyon and Ireland
episodes.description: The teams do a burro race and a tightrope race at the Grand Canyon, then a "catch the leprechaun" contest and a "hole-in-one" golf tournament in Ireland.

episodes.title: Hawaii and Norway
episodes.description: The teams do surfing and an outrigger race in Hawaii; then a Viking longboat race and a "long jump wearing snowshoes" in Norway.

episodes.title: North Pole and Tahiti
episodes.description: The contestants do a dog sled race and an igloo-building contest at the North Pole; and an "around the reef pontoon paddle-boat race" and a sandcastle-building contest in Tahiti.

episodes.title: Arizona and Holland
episodes.description: The teams do a wild-bronco-riding contest and steer roping in Arizona; then a windmill riding contest and a dyke building contest in Holland.

episodes.title: Quebec and Baghdad
episodes.description: The teams do lacrosse batting and Canadian tree cutting in Quebec; then flying carpet races and magic rope climbing in Baghdad.

episodes.title: Russia and the Caribbean
episodes.description: The contestants ran a moose sled marathon in Siberia and a Hopak dance race in Moscow. After that, they participated in a porpoise race and a hunt for Bluebeard's treasure in the Caribbean.

episodes.title: New York and Turkey
episodes.description: The contestants have a Hansom cab race and a "crown the Statue of Liberty" contest in New York; then a unicycle race and a swimming relay race in Turkey.

episodes.title: South America and Transylvania
episodes.description: The contestants try to lasso a computer-controlled bull in Argentina and race rubber rafts down the Amazon River in Brazil, then a scavenger hunt for monster-related items and a log-roll race through the Brack Lagoon in Transylvania.

episodes.title: French Riviera and New Zealand
episodes.description: The contestants do a soapbox derby and a free-flight kite contest on the French Riviera; then an ostrich race and a mud-puddle tug-of-war in New Zealand.

episodes.title: Morocco and Washington, D.C.
episodes.description: The participants run a roller-scooter race through the Casbah, in Casablanca, and a chariot race in Morocco's desert, followed by a rally race and an obstacle course in Washington, D.C..
